data.title: 1960s Archives
data.text:
The Wackiest Ship in the Army (Series 1965-1966) is an American comedy-adventure series that aired for one season on NBC between September 19, 1965, and April 17, 1966. Produced by Harry Ackerman and Herbert Hirschman, the series was loosely based on the 1960 ...

The Wackiest Ship in the Army (1960). The story is a fictionalized comedy of a real ship known as the USS Echo. It was a sailing vessel that originated in New Zealand and became part of ...

Purple Noon (1960) Plein Soleil, Full Sun, Blazing Sun, Lust for Evil, and Talented Mr. Ripley. Tom Ripley is a talented mimic, moocher, forger and all-around criminal improviser; but there’s more to Tom Ripley than even he can guess. ...

Swiss Family Robinson (1960). This heroic tale chronicles the courageous exploits of the Robinson family after they are shipwrecked on a deserted island. Using teamwork and ingenuity, they skillfully overcome the obstacles of nature and ...

Rage of the Buccaneers (1961). After gaining leadership of his band, the Black Pirate turns his attentions to ridding San Salvador of its slave trade. Directed by Mario Costa Produced by Ottavio Poggi Written by ...

The Devil-Ship Pirates (1964). The Devil-Ship Pirates is a 1964 British pirate adventure film directed by Don Sharp. The story surrounds pirates from a vessel from the defeated Spanish Armada terrorizing citizens on the English coast. ...

Seven Seas to Calais (1962). Englishman Sir Francis Drake (Rod Taylor) is a plague upon Spain. Routinely attacking their ships and stealing their gold, Drake makes it his duty to cause as much devastation to ...

The Pirates of Blood River (1962). In a Caribbean village populated by religious refugees, Jonathon Standing (Kerwin Mathews) gets caught in an affair with the wife of a prominent local. Standing is sent to a ...

Fury at Smugglers’ Bay (1961). Pirate wreckers ravage a small seaside community while the ineffectual local squire tries to discourage his son’s romance with a smuggler’s pretty daughter. Directed by John Gilling Produced by John ...
